args:
A magic scholar named Heinwald and an
inquisitor named Curran appear at the Halidom.
The two have been pursuing an incident in
which the residents of a village disappeared.
If they can resurrect an ancient sealed library,
they just might be able to solve the mystery.
Hmm. I don't think I know that man.
Apologies for the sudden intrusion, but\nare you from around here? I'm looking for\nsomeone named {player_name}.
That would be me. And who are you?
Whoops! Sorry about that. My name's\nCurran, and I'm an inquisitor.
Is that a term I should know, Elly?\n...Or perhaps be worried about?

Inquisitors are members of the Ilian
Church. They investigate if adherents
hold misguided views, and guide them
back to the path of righteousness if so.
Given that I abandoned the Church,\nhe may well be here for me.
Ah, so YOU are the Paladyn Elisanne!\nI actually remember seeing your name\non the list of heretics.
If you think to take me, you have another—

Stay your hand, my lady. I'm not so simple
as to believe those who hold different
opinions from the Church are instantly
guilty of heresy.
That does not sound like something\nan inquisitor would say.
Yeah, I get that a lot. I guess you could\nsay that I'm a heretical heretic hunter.
For just like beauty, heretics are also\nin the eye of the buttholder.
(I'm fairly certain that's not the saying.)
Perhaps you should stick to simple phrases\nand stop trying to sound impressive.
Merely attending to some minor business.
I thought I told you we don't have time\nfor any unnecessary side-trips.
It wasn't unnecessary—it was essential.\nOr it was to me, at any rate.
All right, what exactly is going on here?\nWho ARE you two?
I am Heinwald, a seeker of truth.
He researches magic and so forth—and\noccasionally lends a hand with my work.
And why have an inquisitor and a\nmagic scholar come to our castle?
It's actually a teeeensy bit complicated.
I was called to investigate\na village called Hethiwood.
Yep. Apparently the village was worshiping\nsomething other than Ilia.

Now, if they just believed in another deity,
that's not really my business. But we'd
heard rumors that whatever they were
worshiping was something...darker.
Wait. You were investigating an\nentire VILLAGE for heresy?
Yeah, it was a first for me, too.\nThat's why I wanted to move cautiously.
But when I got there, the village\nwas...gone.
Well, the village was still there.\nBut the residents had vanished.
Perhaps they were attacked by fiends.
I considered that, but there were no tracks\nor signs of a struggle. It was like all 209\npeople simply popped out of existence.
It was not the ENTIRE village, Curran.\nYou really must learn to be more\nexacting in your speech.
Ah, right. We actually did manage to\nfind one person—so I guess that means\nonly 208 people vanished.

It's this girl—whose name is Lathna,
according to the village register.
So far as we can tell, she's the
only person left.
Did you ask her what happened?
She seems to have lost the power of\nspeech—perhaps from the shock of\nwhatever happened to her village.
Like I said, it's a real unusual event.\nThankfully, I've got a pal who knows\njust what to do in situations like this.
Were I to name someone my ＂pal,＂\nI'd hope that they had a bit more of a \ndiscerning eye; a bit more thoughtfulness.
Still, had I not decided to join you,\nI never would have seen the fabled\nLiber Grimortis with my own eyes.
It is a legendary book of sorcery\nthat we found in the village.

The entire book was thought lost long ago,
with only copied fragments left. So for us
to discover it in the village is a truly
historic moment!
Our current theory is that the people of\nHethiwood may have been trying to use\nsome of the magic in said book.
But in order to investigate the truth of \nthis situation, we must read and analyze\nthe Liber Grimortis itself.
However, we currently lack sufficient\nmaterials to decipher it, which is why we\ndecided to awaken the Library Obscura.
That sounds...ominous.\nCare to fill us in?

Within the pages of the Liber Grimortis,
there is a description of a library said
to house materials on every taboo
subject conceivable.
This library was sealed away in ages past\nby some unknown actor.
And you think it a good idea to\nRELEASE this seal?!
Of course! Can you imagine the extent of\nthe knowledge contained within its halls?\nI simply cannot wait!
I fear your enthusiasm may be\nterribly misplaced, sir!

Don't get the wrong idea—we aren't
cracking the seal just to satisfy this
guy's curiosity; we're doing it for the
people of Hethiwood.
Plus, if it's full of forbidden things,\nit's my duty as an inquisitor to check\nthat out and see what's what.
So why tell us all of this?
As it turns out, the place where the\nlibrary was sealed away is supposedly\nvery near to here.
We have been in this castle for quite some\ntime and never heard of a magical library.
It was likely sealed away long before this\ncastle even came into existence.
But that would be ages ago!

Anyway, that's what we know right now.
Figured it would be best to swing by
and let you know the score before we
started poking around your lands.
But if you're going to this Library Obscura,\nI'd like to come along.
You sure? It's going to be dangerous.
All the more reason I should come.\nI can't ignore a possible danger\nso close to our home.
Well, far be it from me to turn down a guy\nwho doesn't shirk his duties.
It's like they say: you either lead,\nfollow, or get out the bidet!
(Er...did he mean ＂get out of the way?＂)
(Aaaah ha ha! This guy is the BEST!)
How long do you plan on standing\nthere making a fool of yourself?\nThe day grows late!
That's enough out of you, Mr. ＂I Was\nJust Checking On A Small Matter!＂
Unthinkable. I would never waste time!
And yet thanks to you, we've wasted time\non numerous occasions up to this point!
I could say the exact same thing back to\nyou. Why, just the other day...
...I'm not certain any of those people\nare going to be all right.
Still, they seem like okay sorts, all-in-all.
I guess we'll find out, won't we?\nCome on, everyone.
